titleStmt.title: Thomas E. Bramlette, Secretary of State, Ephraim L. Van Winkle
CWG1687

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
IN THE NAME AND BY THE AUTHORITY OF
The Commonwealth of Kentucky,
THOMAS E. BRAMLETTE,
GOVERNOR OF SAID COMMONWEALTH.
To all whom these Present shall come, Greeting:

Know Ye, That E. L. VanWinkle having been duly appointed "Secretary of State" for the Commonwealth of Kentucky. I hereby invest him with full power and authority to execute and discharge the duties of the said office according to law: And to have and to hold the same, with all the rights and emoluments thereto legally appertaining, for and during the term prescribed by law.

In Testimony Whereof, I have caused these letters to be made patent and the Seal of the Commonwealth to be hereunto affixed. Done at Frankfort, the 1st day of Sept, in the year of our Lord, one thousand eight hundred and 63, and in the 72d year of the Commonwealth.

Thos. E. Bramlette
BY THE GOVERNOR:
, Secretary of State.
Commonwealth Office -- WM. E. HUGHES, State Printer.
Secretary of State
E. L. Vanwinkle
Appd Sept 1.
1863
State of Kentucky - Franklin County Sct --

I do certify that E. L. Vanwinkle this day personally appeared before me and took the oath as Secretary of State for the state of Kentucky according to the first section of the 8th article of the constitution- Given under my hand as presiding Judge of Franklin County Court this 18th, Sept: 1863 --

J. Swigert presiding
Judge of Franklin County-
